GFRY Studio 2013-2014. A platform for proposals.

Through a combination of direct experience, course readings, fieldtrips, individual research and discussion, each person in the class has investigated historical and contemporary contexts, and the social, political, cultural, economic and ecological dimensions of their project. Educators, Makers and Thinkers have created creative solutions based upon individual interests and foundational information through project ideas, development, and materials.


Light Tunnel Project

Well designed public space must allows the users to interact with the environment and the people around them regar- less of age, income level, cultural background, or social status.

Type: maker

Yollocalli Teen Space

Artists working in collaboration with community members, to figuratively, literally, and critically reimagine, the spaces around us.

Type: educator

People's Platform

A device that will encourage people to interact with each other in a more meaningful way.

Type: maker

Art/design toolkit for explorations in public space

Using performance art interventions and participatory design tools to invite community conversations and inclusive workshops for the exploration and re-imagining of public space.

Type: thinker

10 East Lake Street reinvented

Encouraging the conversation about the reinvention of underutilized public space through a sustainability, technology and culture.

Type: maker

Free Sample Architecture

Foster agency and embrace democratic design through welcoming, hands-on access to design processes, available directly to the inhabitants of public spaces.

Type: maker

The Miniature Chicago

The moment of serendipity; harmoniously curated sensory experiences to evoke new emotions.

Type: maker
